ISSUE.TITLE: README.md uses an image link with an absolute path
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: OK, not a very important issue: The README.md files of the `release 0.9` and `master` use an image link with an absolute path ``` ``` GitHub seems fault-tolerant and handles the link as if the leading slash wouldn't be existing but in other environments the image would probably not displayed. By the way, the screenshot images now added in the README.md of `master` also use relative paths.

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: chore: published v0.9.23 Signed-off-by: Pranav C Balan <pranavxc@gmail.com>

COMMIT.MESSAGE: docs: correct image path Update main image path from absolute path to relative closes #225 Signed-off-by: Pranav C Balan <pranavxc@gmail.com>
